title: Katie Price's ex toyboy lover Charles Drury 'signs up for winter series of Love Island'
text:
Love Island has reportedly signed the ex lover of Katie Price to star in its first ever Winter series.

The Sun report Charles Drury, 22, has been in talks with ITV2 bosses to appear in the upcoming series which will hit screens in January.

The newly single hunk, who boasts 8k Instagram followers, could prove to be TV gold as insiders hope he'll spill secrets on Katie, 41, and their short fling.

Looking for love: Love Island has reportedly signed Charles Drury, the ex lover of Katie Price to star in its first ever Winter series

The builder has reportedly been on Love Island bosses' radar since last year but was dating someone so was ruled out of the matchmaking series.

A source says 'now he's single, producers called him up and asked him to re-audition for the show.'

'Nothing's signed yet and he's not even sure if he wants to do it but they're keen to meet him,' adding that 'Katie will be furious when she finds out – he'd have girls falling over him, and he's bound to talk about what dating Katie was like if he makes it into the villa.'

Famous ex: Katie and Charles were reportedly introduced by a builder working on Katie's mansion, who encouraged her to follow Charles on social media

Katie and Charles were reportedly introduced by a builder working on Katie's mansion, who encouraged her to follow Charles on social media.

Charles is based in Chesterfield, and he and Katie had been accused of previously meeting up at a hotel in the Cotswolds after his good looks caught her eye on social media.

When they met Katie was thought to be in a relationship with Kris Boyson, but she reportedly dumped her boyfriend by text after being accused of cheating when she secretly flew Charles to Turkey.

Making headlines: The newly single hunk, who boasts 8k Instagram followers, could prove to be TV gold as insiders hope he'll spill secrets on Katie, 41, and their short fling

Charles' fling with Katie has come to an abrupt halt though after Katie was seen sneaking out of Kris' house a week ago.

Speaking of the surprise visit to her ex, it was claimed that the mother-of-five realised she was now 'in hot water' with Charles, who she left behind in her mucky Horsham mansion.

Charles has hinted at the end of the romance on Instagram, posting on Monday night: 'You never really forget the ones who touched your heart; regardless whether its the ones who broke it or healed it.'

Cryptic: Charles has hinted at the end of the romance on Instagram, posting a heartbreak quote on Instagram on Monday, a week after Katie was seen with her ex Kris Boyson

He shared a second quote that read: 'Good things come to those who wait. But better things come to those who work for it.'

The winter series of Love Island is lining up a series of hot hunks in time for January, with Jay Munro, a former footballer turned model and Instagram sensation, also reportedly set to appear.

The Scottish hunk went viral in Australia this summer when he became known as the 'hot door pusher' on The Voice, and now could be making a name for himself on UK screens.

Headed for the villa: Former footballer turned model and social media star Jay Munro has also reportedly been signed up for the new winter series of Love Island

While applications are open for the upcoming series until November 30, talks have reportedly already started with an array of sexy singletons.

According to the Daily Star, Jay, who boasts 50k Instagram followers, was in the running to appear on the last series of Love Island but producers reportedly held him back for the new series.

'Jay will be the one all the girls will be chasing. Just like Tommy Fury, he's a sportsman, in good shape and has dreamy looks,' a source said.

MailOnline has contacted Love Island representatives for comment.

In demand: Jay, who boasts 50k Instagram followers, was in the running to appear on the last series of Love Island but producers reportedly held him back for the new series

Jay has a packed CV, previously planning to be a pro-footballer, playing in the Falkirk youth team before going full-time with Partick Thistle and Queen of the South.

The Glasgow-born sportsman gave up on football though to become a full-time model.

Jay's modelling work seems to take him all over the world, as he has recently shared photos from destinations including Bali and Ibiza.

Hunk: Jay has a packed CV, previously planning to be a pro-footballer before turning to modelling full time

Fan base: Jay landed a job as a 'door pusher' on The Voice Australia over the summer, opening the door to the audition room for contestants and sending viewers wild with his good looks

But during the summer in settled in Sydney and landed a job as a 'door pusher' on The Voice Australia, opening the door to the audition room for contestants.

He promptly sent viewers into meltdown thanks to his hunky looks and after fans tried to track him down online, Channel Nine confirmed the mystery crew member's identity.

Jay will have some competition on Love Island as it was reported last month that bosses have reportedly set their sights on a hunky fitness model as the first contestant.

According to The Sun, producers are keen on Loughborough personal trainer Ellis Iyayi, 20, who already has more than 7,000 loyal followers on Instagram.

Single and ready to mingle: Jay will have some competition on Love Island as it was reported last month that bosses have reportedly set their sights on hunky fitness model a Ellis Iyayi, 20

A source told The Sun: 'Ellis is over the moon about it - he's had to be sworn to secrecy about it but he's been in to meet producers a few times and they love him - he can't wait to get in the villa.

'Ellis is exactly what the show is looking for and he ticks all the boxes - he will make great television.' MailOnline has contacted Love Island for comment.

As well as being a personal trainer, Ellis has modelled for big brands including ASOS, Nike and GymShark.

His Instagram is littered with shirtless photos of him in the gym and on sun-soaked holidays.

Hot stuff: Producers are said to be keen on Loughborough personal trainer Ellis who has more than 7,000 loyal followers on Instagram already

An air date for the winter series of Love Island has yet to be confirmed for ITV2 but it's thought to hit screens early next year.

The show will move locations from Mallorca, Spain to Cape Town, South Africa, to ensure plenty of sunshine.

2020 marks the first year that there will be two series of the smash hit reality show, following it's climbing ratings over the past five series.

And host Caroline Flack is cashing in on her new workload, as she is reportedly set to 'triple' her fee and 'only agreed to commit to both series with a massive pay rise.'

According to The Mirror, Caroline 'drove a hard bargain' when re-negotiating her contract ahead of the latest addition to the Love Island franchise.

'Her fee for two months each year was £450,000 plus expenses but she’d only agree to commit to both series with a massive pay rise.'
